Reviews.Title: YOU WERE WARNED NO 4G LTE IN THE US!
Reviews.Author: DVLDOG
Reviews.Content: Everyone was calling me crazy when I tried to tell everyone this phone is not 4G-LTE capable in the US and because of misleading advertising the had to put(NO 4G IN THE USA)Samsung Galaxy Note II N7105 White 4G/LTE Factory Unlocked International Version LTE/4G BANDS 800 / 900 / 1800 / 2600 by Samsung (no 4g in the USA)

Reviews.Title: Nice product and lte supported
Reviews.Author: Murat Parlakisik
Reviews.Content: you can also use it in european countries . its lte range also supported .very good performance and best android phone in the market.

Reviews.Title: Really nice device
Reviews.Author: john bower
Reviews.Content: The common downsides identified are its size and the inclusion of the stylus, of which both aspects are clearly advertised. The stylus features are well implemented but I am faster writing long messages with the swipe style keyboard. This doesn't mean the stylus doesn't come in handy for sketches and browsing. I find the size is ideal, it still fits in my pocket and just about allows for multiple application windows on the same screen (another excellent feature). Also the quality of the screen is excellent.The phone is chocked full of inivation and seems to me tailor made for android Jelly Bean (the Operating system). It tries out a lot of new concepts and if you would like simplicity and style then perhaps it's not ideal (as it happen I have apple devices as well but it's nice to see such new ideas). The Samsung proprietary applications don't get much use on my phone but system integration with the phone characteristics means that things like the stylus, screen size and camera can still be used to great affect.This specific model comes with an LTE 4G band common to Europe and not America so it's worth doing a bit of research into which band is supported in your current location.Highly recommended if you understand what you are buying.

Reviews.Title: Greatest phone Ever
Reviews.Author: Wnate601 "wnate"
Reviews.Content: I use Straight Talk and it took a day for the SMS to work but now it's the greatest phone I have ever had. So many features I still haven't gotten them all yet. It arrive quickly and packaged extra carefully.

Reviews.Title: A Great Phone with Inherent Flaws
Reviews.Author: Johnny Saigon®
Reviews.Content: Let's get to the nitty gritty:Pros:1- It's BIG. Big for gaming, big for videos, big for web browsing. Simply put, if you want a phone with the most real estate on the screen size, then there is no alternative. Don't be so mesmerized on the 1080p screens that will come out soon. Unless you want to destroy your eyes and use the phone from an inch away, you will not notice the difference in everyday use.2- It's fast. Yes, the Qualcomm S4 Pro quad-core beats this Tegra 3/Exynos 4 CPU in most benchmarks, but again, unless you are a hard-core geek that is OCD on numbers, you will not notice any difference in everyday use. There is no discernible lag anywhere (it's probably just your slow Internet connection).3- It's beautiful. Not HTC or Sony beautiful, but this is one sleek and stylish phone. The white is classic, but the Titanium Gray is also super slick. Just check out the back cover and you will see what I mean (yes, even with that cheap-feeling plastic material).4- Did I mention the screen? It's BIG, it's bright, and it's beee-ay-eeww-ti-ful! AMOLED screens have awesome color saturation and contrast (most times even overkill, actually). Some people say it's not good in daylight. Um, have you tried cranking up the brightness??5- The Samsung/Android touch. Not everyone may like Samsung's Touchwiz user interface compiled onto Android, but I dare you to find a phone with more features than this one (and similarly the Galaxy S3). Here are the main highlights:a. Samsung utilizes the front facing camera almost to perfection. You can use it to control your music player; it has facial recognition to sense you are directly in front of the screen so it won't dim and turn off the screen (for reading, web browing, video playback, etc.); it recognizes your facial orientation so that when you are lying down sideways looking at the screen, the accelerometer will not kick in to auto-rotate the screen in the wrong orientation. That is something that has always bothered me with other phones and FINALLY someone has added that feature! Granted, not all these features work flawlessly, but it's a great start.b. Integration with Google is finally starting to show off in good ways. It was always once that Apple had the superior ecosystem. But now we see the future is bright indeed. Not just evolution, but finally innovation!c. The S Pen and all the neat things you can do with it. Preview a point in the movie before skipping to that point, and other things like going old-school back to the PDA days!6- It accepts up to a 64GB microSD card. That turned out to be the dealbreaker for me. Explanation in "cons" section below.Cons:1- It's BIG. With my tiny hands(hey hey), I can hardly do anything one-handed with this phone. Pocketability rating: -2. Putting it up on your face to make a phone call is also a big fail if you're sensitive to public ridicule like me. Have your Bluetooth earpiece ready.2- It's quite heavy. I really wanted to switch to the Verizon Droid DNA - for a 5-inch screen, it was remarkably svelte and light. And if it wasn't for the fact of pi$$-poor Verizon customer service at their call centers, and that it only had 16GB of memory with no microSD card option, I would have made the switch. The Droid DNA is superior in every way except those things mentioned. I have absolutely no doubt that the Samsung Note 3 (and maybe even the Galaxy S4) will be a 1080p screen with the Exynos 5 quadcore - can't wait!3- The screen may be bright and colorful, but it's way over-saturated and unnatural. Fortunately, you can go to the screen options and set it to "Natural." "Dynamic" is overkill, and even so is "Standard."Conclusion:Even with its inherent flaws, I can't help but love it. It's not even a phone, it's a cellular tablet(cablet, anyone??). I'm going to keep it. Until the next big thing is already here....

Reviews.Title: broken seal? french phone?
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: the phone itself is greatbut there are few things i didn't like..first of all, 2 out of 3 seals of the box were broken..but i don't care as long as the product is goodand i realized that this phone is made for french company 'orange'..so there were some french apps installed in the phone that i couldn't delete ... and when i tried to use it , it was just full of french words that i didn't get..but apart from these, the product is amazinggg i love it!!

Reviews.Title: great phone!
Reviews.Author: normanbonz
Reviews.Content: The phone serves me a lot! Especially at work where I need to scribe technical information often in production floor and i don't want to bring my massive 15" laptop or write on a paper.  The features are very useful, I can't ask for more other than a 1080 resolution and a higher MP camera.  If only the first unit I bought didn't had busted Back and Menu buttons, I will give a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Way better than iPhone 5
Reviews.Author: Prince_of_Cosette
Reviews.Content: This phone is absolutely amazing. I had the iPhone 5 before this actually, and hated it. It would always lag and the screen was so tiny. Finally after almost throwing it out the window a couple times, I sold it and got this phone instead. No lag, nice big screen for multimedia, and the customization on this thing is mind boggling. Best decision I have made in a while. Only problem is that since it's a international version, there's no LTE in the states. But I don't live in the city and still get 4G so I'm good.

Reviews.Content: I had the Note 1 it was awesome. I thought the Note 2 would be even better but it is difficult to find accessories that is compatible to this particular model.  But none the less it performs just as good or even better than the Note 1.

Reviews.Content: this is a great phone or pc but the wifi hang ups are horrible not letting me connect to wifi for hr's at times and i have tried all remedy's to no avail pulling the battery seems to work best but some times that does not work  I think the problem is probably coming from data mining by the NSA i want to sell this one and buy a new one to see if that would fix it so im looking for the same phone any body have any new solutions im all ears

Reviews.Title: Very nice phone
Reviews.Author: Cupcake
Reviews.Content: Have to admit that I am not a fan of touch screen; but this phone is really a good one.  The box was opened when I received the package.  However, all accessories are inside.  Guess the phone that I received was intended for Singapore market.  But anyway, it works great and the WiFi connection speed is extremely fast.  What I don't like about are:1.  Cannot connect to 5.0 GHz, only 2.4 GHz, via Wifi.2.  Screen is smaller than Note.3.  Back cover is flimsy, probably the worst of all the phones that I had.4.  No 4G in NYCSamsung did a great job in making software more user friendly.  Overall, this is a great phone which performs much better than newer versions.

Reviews.Title: It's a great, great Smartphone !
Reviews.Author: Fabio  Okipney
Reviews.Content: I think it's a amazing cell phone . His huge screen does offer a great experience using the internet and gaming. But I had the Note One and I think Samsung made a mistake here shrinking the screen. It is bigger than Note One in numbers but when you hold horizontally, it seems smaller tha Note 1. But it's a great phone. I dream in having a Note 2 processor and RAM with the screen size of the Note 1. Think about that Sammy!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Zac
Reviews.Content: This phone is amazing! The costumer service is really nice and will help you with anything your having trouble with.Pros:-The phone is big-Clear screen-Works like its brand new-Really nice costumer service-Pretty good battery life-Easy to use, once you get the hang of it-Comes with a stylist, i thought i would never use it but i do more then i thought!Cons:-It was a bit hard for me to connect to my phone service's 4g.-takes a little while to charge, but its not to long-kinda big for a guys pocket, mainly pulling it in and out of your pocketHonestly I couldn't find any cons, I can only think of positive things to say about the company and the phone. I would totally recommend this phone to anyone who wants to upgrade, however it won't be the best phone for new smartphone users. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: No WIFI

Reviews.Content: I cannot use wifi whatsoever, can't even scan any wifi at home. Thought the phone needed upgrade, but nope, same problem exists. I don't recommend this phone to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone...

Interestingly enough, it is for the Australian market so the navigation software map for it is Australian and some apps are specifically for that part of the world as well. Other than that, no big headache. Works fine here in Europe.

Reviews.Title: Correct Information
Reviews.Author: Sai
Reviews.Content: On 7/11/13 I had ordered N7105 White device. I had got a call from world wide distributors on 7/12 from stating that they do not have a White colored device in their inventory and they had only 2 damaged pieces. However they could ship me a Gray device.I said, i do not want a Gray device.Shortly thereafter i got a message from Amazon that my order has been cancelled and the reason for cancellation is CUSTOMER CANCELLED.This reason for cancellation is slightly misleading i felt - It should be OUT OF STOCK than initiation from customer.I hope Amazon and world wide distributors take cognizance of this fact and correct their records so that any other customers like me would not spend much time and energy and also it aid to the cause of putting accurate information enabling customers to take better decisions in future.

Reviews.Content: I chose thos rating becuse I have spent $800 in this phone and it is not worth it.Every day new issue.I already got the phone with factory problem. The headphones jack does not work.I really hate this phone.
